answers.author: Philip Munck
answers.text:
New Hampshire does not allow the taxation of machinery and tools and generally does not allow taxation of personal property.  There are items that are classed as real property that are somewhat more grey, however.  For example, electric power lines, poles and transformers are considered real property.  [Curiously, at the moment telephone poles and wire are not taxable.]  Most jurisdictions that have gone away from personal property taxes have done so because it is so difficult to find without significant taxpayer assistance.  That would be more true of tools, for example, that for larger items of machinery.

author: James Stegmaier
text:
What other states allow for localities to levy a variety of property taxes? 
Specificially I am interested in knowing if other localities outside of Viriginia levy a machinery and tools property tax. This tax would be similar to a personal business property tax, but we segregate taxes on machinery and tools from taxes on other assets.
Thanks!
Megan Bourke
Chesterfield County, VA
bourkem@chesterfield.gov
title: Machinery and Tools Property Tax
